intro: Lippia bracteosa, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open areas and has hairy, narrow leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lippia bracteosa is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
